title: Final Whistle : Hoops , Heismans , & Home Field Advantage
body_text:
Final Whistle: Hoops, Heismans, & Home Field Advantage
GRAND JUNCTION, Colo. (KKCO) - On a packed Final Whistle, we have action on the courts, gridiron, and a Colorado Athlete gets named best college football player in the country, plus a preview of the College Football Playoffs.
Over in the Front Range, the Colorado Mesa Mavericks Men’s and Women’s Basketball Teams both continued their Front Range road trip taking on the Colorado Mines Orediggers.
The Men’s team was looking for their first Rocky Mountain Athletic Conference win, after starting conference play 0-3. Once again the Mavericks battled and played close, but ultimately could not close things out, with offensive struggles, particularly from three point range, where the Mavs went 2-12, and lost 65-58.
The Women’s Team rode another stellar performance from Olivia Reed-Thyne, her 27th career double-double to the win at a final of 67-48.
On the Western Slope, and across the state, the High School hoops season is rolling along, with one Fruita Monument Star hooper hitting a prestigious milestone.
Also on this week’s installment, the College Football Playoff Bracket is here, and who does not love unsolicited opinions on how the first-ish round will go
Plus Colorado two-way star Travis Hunter is named the best College Football player in the country, winning the second ever Heisman in program history, you can read more on that here.
